parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "job_name": "SJP",
    "mail_user": "joel.niklaus@inf.unibe.ch",
    "mail_type": "end,fail",
    "nodes": 1,
    "ntasks_per_node": 1,
    "memory": "64GB",
    "cpus_per_task": 1,
    "gpu": "rtx3090:1",
    "time": "20-00:00:00",
    "qos": "job_gpu_stuermer",
    "partition": "gpu-invest",
    "array": "2-4",
    "conda_environment": "sjp",
    "command": "bash run.sh",
    "arguments": "--train_type=$1 --train_mode=$2 --model_name=$3 --model_type=$4 --train_languages=$5 --test_languages=$6 --jurisdiction=$7 --data_augmentation_type=$8 --train_sub_datasets=$9 --sub_datasets=${10} --seed=${SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID} --debug=False",
    "output_file": "current-run.out"
  }
}
```

This script is running under the **SLURM** workload manager. It utilizes several resources:

* **GPU:** NVIDIA RTX 3090
* **Memory:** 64 GB
* **CPU:** 1 core
* **Time:** 20 days
* **Conda environment:** "sjp"
* **Partition:** "gpu-invest"
* **Quality of Service (QoS):** "job_gpu_stuermer" 

The script also defines a job array, meaning it will run multiple instances of the script, each with a different value for the `SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID` variable. 

The script then activates the "sjp" conda environment and executes the "bash run.sh" command, passing several arguments including the values of the job array.  The output of the script is redirected to the file "current-run.out".
